intro: Orlaya topaliana, commonly known as the lesser water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. It thrives in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. Orlaya topaliana is often found in temperate regions and is considered a herbaceous perennial.
